result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald L Jones II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 67 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Fine ($1,1519) is to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs ($35) to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Sheriff's Department as a Condition of Extended Supervision.  DNA surcharge ($250) to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel during the term of extended supervision.
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 67 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Count 1.

superMiscConds.notes: Court costs ($268) to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervsivion.  DNA surcharge waived on Count 2.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Count 1.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Ronald L Jones in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Reisha Mitchell.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to both counts 1 & 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of both counts 1 & 2.
Repeater enhancer on both counts 1 & 2 is struck.
Count 3 is dismissed as a read-in.
Defendant presented statements to the court.


Court orders the following:
Count 1:
Total Prison: 33 Months
Initial Confinement:  15 Months
Extended Supervision:  18   Months
Concurrent to count 2
67 Days Credit

36  Months D/L REVOCATION
36  Months IGNITION INTERLOCK

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel during the term of extended supervision.
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.  
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 (to be forward to Waukesha County Sheriff's Department);
Fine:  $1,519
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $250.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.



Count 2:
Total Prison: 33  Months
Initial Confinement:  15 Months
Extended Supervision: 18    Months
Concurrent to count 1.
67 Days Credit

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Same as Count 1.

Costs:  $268
DNA Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant Ronald L Jones in court, in custody, with attorney Reisha Mitchell.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Douglas G. from the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. State presents exhibit #1 marked and received. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over. Defense objects. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.
